GameCore

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameCore.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Map object is used to store information about the game map. This includes the height and width, as well as the mapArray which at each point in the array, contains a MapSign which indicated what is in that position (such as WALL or EMPTY) New game maps can also be generated, stored to a file, a loaded from a file.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createMap

        public static void createMap(Map map,
             java.lang.String filename)
        This method writes the input map to a location specified. The map is stored as a serialized object at the location specified.

        It is assumed this method will receive a valid file location, there is no guarantee of its performance outside this case.

        Parameters:
        map - A Map file to write to the hard disk.
        filename - A String object which contains the directory to write to.

      • loadMapFromFile

        public void loadMapFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
        This method will load a map from a file. Specifically, it takes a String location path and loads that into this Map object.

        This method is only guaranteed to work if the map either exists or does not exist. It is not guaranteed if the .map file is not the expected serialized file.

        Parameters:
        filename - A String object with the location of the file to load up.

      • saveMapToFile

        public void saveMapToFile(java.lang.String filename)
        This method writes this Map object to a file in a serialized fashion. The location of output is defined.

        This map assumes this map file is a valid map file, which should be true by type-safety in java.

        Parameters:
        filename - A String object containing the location to write to.
